meanings.definition: A topic that is a part of a larger topic.
meanings.sent1: In our science class, we learned about different subtopics like plants and animals.
meanings.sent2: The book has several subtopics, including history, geography, and science.
meanings.sent3: The subtopics in the math textbook seemed to have a secret meeting after school.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library full of subtopics waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The subtopics in the presentation were like puzzle pieces coming together to form a complete picture.

meanings.definition: Topics that are smaller parts of a main topic.
meanings.sent1: The subtopics in the essay covered different aspects of the main idea.
meanings.sent2: When studying history, it's important to understand the subtopics within each time period.
meanings.sent3: The subtopics at the party were the center of attention, discussing their main topic.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like a web, with the main idea at the center and subtopics branching out.
meanings.sent5: The subtopics in the conversation added depth and richness to the overall discussion.
